website_summaries.verdict: With a single ply coated finish, this Remo drumhead combines controlled sustain with bright, warm tones.
pros: Provides bright attack and controlled sustain
Ideal for tom and bass drums
Especially good for jazz and blues
cons: Sound is too bright for some players' tastes

customer_reviews.title: It's the same good trusty ol' wonderful Ambassador
customer_reviews.text: It's a coated Remo skin. Can get tight and tasty near the rim, or produce a big fat dead blow. Nice scritchy-scratchy brushes sounds. Detunes so very well for that 'bwaoouuiing" noise. You can even put these on your toms, at the very least doubling your fun! And they're cheap enough that you can bang the crap out of them with little financial consequence if they split. Remo's quality hasn't changed appreciably during the 15 years I've been playing, far as I can tell, so there's zero reason I can't recommend this skin. There might be some more boutique pieces, but why, unless you're doing super serious session stuff in the studio?
customer_reviews.author: M L

customer_reviews.title: Quality Keeps The Customer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first Remo drum heads around the same time Ronald Reagan was sworn into office. Consistent quality and an ever-expanding line of products has kept me a satisfied customer since then. One of only a couple of manufactures that can fill and ship special sizes quickly and at a reasonable price. I would have given 5 stars, but the " clear " Ambassador is actually a bit hazy. Just a personal preference to have absolutely clear heads and not anything that diminishes the product quality.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Anglin

customer_reviews.title: Great but Evans is better
customer_reviews.text: This head has great sound, and I was satisfied with the quality and price. After a couple weeks of moderate playing, the coating had already started to come off in the center, which doesn't really bother me but I know some people don't like it. Soon after I got this head, I bought an Evans UV1. The Ambassador is good, but the quality, durability, and sound of the UV1 far surpasses the Remo head. Bottom line: All hail Evans as the greatest drum head makers in the universe try the UV1
customer_reviews.author: T.N.

customer_reviews.title: Golden standard for single ply heads
customer_reviews.text: These heads have been around for quite a while. That pretty much says it. Great for brushes most musical applications. The coating aren't as durable as they once were but that's due to environmental concerns. Hard to go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: PapaG

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement
customer_reviews.text: My prior head just broke (but it was over 15 years old). Not from overuse, and I play light jazz--just broke. This was a good replacement. I do notice the Remo logo size has changed, but doesn't affect anything.
customer_reviews.author: Chanimal

customer_reviews.title: This head is identical to the Yamaha standard Maple Custom drums head
customer_reviews.text: i bought a use 16" Yamaha maple custom with a different head and this head restored the Yamaha sound and made the sound match the rest of my new custom maple Yamaha kit. it was very easy to tune and did not require a lot of stretching and retuning before it stabilized. I holds tune well without bad overtones or ringing when properly seated and tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Barry A. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great vintage look
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace the factory head that a fill in drummer busted pushing it into a mic stand! Decided to add a custom logo to get that vintage look. Came out great and sounds great too. I added a hole reinforcement to this one, to hopefully keep from having it busted.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Amanda

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this head for my 12 inch tom that had an very old head on it, replaced it with the good old reliable Remo Ambassador Coated Drum Head, and it sounds amazing now, nothing like a new drum head to make a drum come alive. This is a perfect drum head for any style of playing, it's perfect for my set and helped my 12 inch tom come alive, amazing skin, with a classic retro sound. No wonder these heads have been around for many years and that pro's and non pro's around the world still use them. Can't beat the price, thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: NoName

customer_reviews.title: The great old. standby
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing drums since High School. No matter what other heads I try, I turn to Remo Ambassador for versatility and touch. It is the best for brushes.
customer_reviews.author: pope

customer_reviews.title: Good "bang for the buck!"
customer_reviews.text: It's a drum head. It's inexpensive. It fit. It was shipped quickly and arrived just as quickly. No problems. If you need one. Buy it if you want to. Simple.
customer_reviews.author: JWS64

customer_reviews.title: but it seems to be of solid quality and it sounds good on recordings (except for the buzz
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a snare drum - I did notice a bit of a rounder tone, but for some reason it's also kinda buzzy and I can't seem to tune the buzz out. I don't know if this is the snare's fault, or the remo head's fault, or mine. probably mine! I'm not a seasoned enough drummer to really be able to give you a full description of the head's effect on the tone of my drum, but it seems to be of solid quality and it sounds good on recordings (except for the buzz.) i sort of hoped it would sound AMAZING, but it sounds good. so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: C. Holford

customer_reviews.title: The Best Head
customer_reviews.text: Remo makes the best snare head at the single ply level! Very responsive and the coating does not chip when using brushes!
customer_reviews.author: Stixxx99

customer_reviews.title: Best in class!
customer_reviews.text: What's to say? This is one of the best snare heads you can buy. I feel like it brings out the quality of the snare.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Top rated/top quality batter head for a reason
customer_reviews.text: 13” Coated Ambassador for my piccolo gives the nice crisp sound for my snare and the crack sound when I rim shot. It has a lot of attack with the dryness of coated heads. I’ve used the coated Ambassador series heads for ten plus years and continue going back to them for the quality of sound I get when tuned correctly and the longevity of the head. They do not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah jones

customer_reviews.title: The sound on this coated snare head is exemplary. ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound on this coated snare head is exemplary. My old coated head was worn out so I decided to upgrade and my ears have been blessed since,
customer_reviews.author: Garo Khachikian

customer_reviews.title: this fit perfectly- so easy to replace
customer_reviews.text: great product, fit perfectly and easy to replace the damaged head. i should have purchased a little tuning wrench along with it
customer_reviews.author: B Hull

customer_reviews.title: REMO RULES
customer_reviews.text: great tone out Remo heads. Go over to YouTube and check out rdavidr
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: The starting point for drum heads.
customer_reviews.text: The industry standard all others compared to.nr for drum heads.
customer_reviews.author: David James

customer_reviews.title: Good for Project
customer_reviews.text: It was for a cheap Tom that got turned into a end table in my living room.
customer_reviews.author: WonderVero

customer_reviews.title: Great Drumhead
customer_reviews.text: I've been drumming for for over 30 years now. I've tried many different drumheads, but I always come back to Remo. The ambassador is a particular favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Best for warm sound
customer_reviews.text: I always recommend these heads . Can't go wrong rock on!
customer_reviews.author: Dewey R. Wise

customer_reviews.title: The standard for batter and resonant heads on toms
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? The Ambassador clear is the standard head for tom batters and resonant heads. I use them as resonant heads under the CS Black Dots and love the sound. I've also recorded with Ambassadors over Ambassadors and also Emperors over Ambassadors. Depends on the sound you are after. You definitely can't go wrong with the Ambassador as your resonant head.
customer_reviews.author: BradGunnerSGT

customer_reviews.title: Fits nice to my 14 Pearl tom
customer_reviews.text: Love it, and cheap than driving to my local music shop twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis Adison

customer_reviews.title: Good tone
customer_reviews.text: Quality product and gives my 10” a good tone. Not choked out like the Aquarian I had. Embassy on the other side and 2 flat cotton balls inside. Just right
customer_reviews.author: greg williams

customer_reviews.title: Great, loud, drum heads. Amazing sound.
customer_reviews.text: They look good. They need a little dampening in my opinion. I am currently using moongel and it works okay, but they sound amazing. If you have a cheap kit, the remo ambassador is what you want (except for the kick drum head). You wont be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it....or maybe you can
customer_reviews.text: Great classic sound. I always go for coated heads, since I use brushes more often than not, and Ambassadors are it for me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gray

customer_reviews.title: The standard for batter or resonant heads on toms
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? The Ambassador clear is the standard head for tom batters and resonant heads. I use them as resonant heads under the CS Black Dots and love the sound. I've also recorded with Ambassadors over Ambassadors and also Emperors over Ambassadors. Depends on the sound you are after. You definitely can't go wrong with the Ambassador as your resonant head.
customer_reviews.author: BradGunnerSGT

customer_reviews.title: Great value, amazing sound.
customer_reviews.text: This is the head! I swear by it. Perfect sounding on almost any snare, tried and true. Even long after considered “spent” it still performs very well and retains awesome sound. Perfect for live, studio, or just jamming. Never had a single issue with this head. Will continue to buy for as long as I can.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size sent
customer_reviews.text: We needed a 16 inch drum head and got a 20 inch drum head. Obviously it doesn't fit. Return was easy as usual. I will order again to see if we actually get a 16 inch drum head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Factory second
customer_reviews.text: Head would not fit, measured 19.5 inches. Also looked like it had been used and shipped several times.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: A good reputation for a reason...
customer_reviews.text: What else can be said... killer drum head on a snare and a Tom. They have a good reputation for a reason. The head stands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: orson corson

customer_reviews.title: My son sounds good on his audition pieces with this new head
customer_reviews.text: The gold standard of snare drum heads according to all my percussionist friends. My son sounds good on his audition pieces with this new head.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thordsen

customer_reviews.title: Best head ever at a great price. . .
customer_reviews.text: . . .On the still unsurpassed and greatest snare drum batter head ever designed. If it ain't broke. . .lower the price.
customer_reviews.author: HSDAD

customer_reviews.title: Great rebound. Best purchase I’ve made thus far for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great rebound. Best purchase I’ve made thus far for my used kit. Don’t forget to order a bottom ( I didn’t know I needed a bottom so I’m passing that along). No need to buy an expensive bottom like this. REMO makes others.
customer_reviews.author: RottnCollie

customer_reviews.title: Best drum heads i have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in about a week ago and i am very impressed. I put on of these on my bass drum and i was amazed at the sound. I have it fairly tight and i stuffed my bass drum with comforters and a pillow. i got a very beefy sound that is wonderful for death metal or any kind of metal or rock. The sound of this drum actually made me decide against triggers for death metal, if that says anything. The sound was very thick and loud. No complaints whatsoever. If you are debating whether to get these, Evans or any of the other brands, GET THESE!!! You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Guy 94

customer_reviews.title: Remo is the best in this business
customer_reviews.text: You never go wrong this these Snares, Remo is definitely the best in this business
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E Ndugga

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding? It's a coated white ambassador. ...
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding? It's a coated white ambassador. You can't go wrong with this as a snare drum head. There are a million fancier, but this one is the standard, the Fender Jazz bass, the SM58 if snare drum heads.
customer_reviews.author: BrooksFe

customer_reviews.title: This is a great all around head!
customer_reviews.text: I had just busted my previous stock drum head and had gotten tipped off about this one. I put this on my snare and got a great sound. The stick has great rebound off the drum head. It has a nice sturdy feeling. You can tell it's a good quality. I play all kinds of metal, but mainly death metal and black metal. This is the perfect head. I believe with the right tuning, this head could work for just about any form of music. I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER BRAND! That's how good these are. I have tested and listened to a bunch of other brands, this one tops them off.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Guy 94

customer_reviews.title: Good Remo quality
customer_reviews.text: Good, heavy-duty head for the price. You'll certainly hear improved sound quality when you replace your junky old head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great on Timbales
customer_reviews.text: Warm tone & crispy attack. I used it on a timbal and perfect pitch on the macho drum. No overtone, no drum dot needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these drum heads!
customer_reviews.text: Made my toms sound great! Using them on a Mahogany Gretsch Catalina Rock kit and they are both warm and punchy. Love these heads!
customer_reviews.author: Casey J

customer_reviews.title: typical Remo Quality at the right price.
customer_reviews.text: Like all of the Ambassador series of heads, this one has the right amount of sustain and durability for my taste. It is infinitely tunable (as much as a 16 inch head can be) and still maintains the tone expected. I have ONLY Remo heads now, they worked for me in the 70s, and after running the gamut of different brands, I am right back to the quality I know and love.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: thump!!
customer_reviews.text: This and a small pillow and I am able to get so much out of my 20" kick. sounds guy love it. the coating keeps it from sounding too slappy but i can tune it up and get a little more jazz tone or loosen it up and get more thud. Still needs to use a kick patch but if you ad that you shouldnt be breaking the head too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: The Lou

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Remo drum heads are great for me as a matter of choice they always perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Needed a replacement for my drum head and this one works just fine!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Needed a replacement for my drum head and this one works just fine! Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Momma

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It's a drum head. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Barmar

customer_reviews.title: Another good Remo head
customer_reviews.text: I usually get the coated Ambassador as it gives the sound I want for brush work but if you are playing a show where brushes aren't needed or you just want that smooth brush sound, this is fine and it gives a bit more bright sound than the coated Ambassadors.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: great sounding drum head
customer_reviews.text: this made my DW snare sound great. I was struggling with a head that sounded good, and this one did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Remo Ambassador Coated Drum Head- 14 Inch
customer_reviews.text: What can I say ! Remo has been making quality drum heads for years and all my snare drums love these heads. I'd highly recommend them as you just can't go wrong with them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Fit my son's junior drum set on his 12 inch drum. Great sound
customer_reviews.author: Shannon C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My old drum head went out so decided to buy one on Amazon so far it's been good and I will order one from the same seller whenever I need another one I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: Typical of Remo heads-Drum and Banjo. Excellent quality, reasonable cost. Can't go wrong with REMO.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Hugh L Strawn

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a head that would give me better sticking control (bounce an definition) and it did
customer_reviews.text: I have a 61/2x14 snare and had a 2 film head on it. I wanted a head that would give me better sticking control (bounce an definition) and it did. The ghost notes are far better now and sounds to my ears great. And rim shots! nice..
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: all good, maybe i will try the emperor next, who knows
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Finn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: I run a studio and my house drummer had me buy new heads (both top and bottom) for the kit. Emperors and Ambassadors. All the heads came quickly, in brand new, undamaged condition and the drums sound great. Pricing was comparable to the online retailers (a few dollars cheaper in some cases).
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: I run a studio and my house drummer had me buy new heads (both top and bottom) for the kit. Emperors and Ambassadors. All the heads came quickly, in brand new, undamaged condition and the drums sound great. Pricing was comparable to the online retailers (a few dollars cheaper in some cases).
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality of sound
customer_reviews.text: I play drums and like the sound of Remo heads.
customer_reviews.author: George Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Remo rules!
customer_reviews.text: I use Remo Ambassador clears as both batter and resonant heads on my toms. I use a Drum Dial to create the same tension on both sides. I also use a Moongel to focus the sound.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic drum head used for a snare drum
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic drum head used for a snare drum. You can't do any wrong when putting a Remo Ambassador drum head on any drum. The resonant sound is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Classic sound. I’m at a loss for anything else to say.
customer_reviews.text: What can you say? It’s just a classic, good drum head. Sounds good, or as good as you can make it sound in my case.
customer_reviews.author: MulletofDeth

customer_reviews.title: Great Snare Head!
customer_reviews.text: Best snare head, ever... in my opinion. Great for both sticks and brushes. You just can't beat this head... well, you can... you just can't find a better one. (Sorry, couldn't help the pun).
customer_reviews.author: ProfessorD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, only using it as a reverb (bottom) head.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: What everyone else tries to copy
customer_reviews.text: Remo is what everyone else tries to copy. Some do a fairly good job, but the copies' sound fades quickly, whereas Remo's sound lasts a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: What everyone else tries to copy
customer_reviews.text: Remo is what everyone else tries to copy. Some do a fairly good job, but the copies' sound fades quickly, whereas Remo's sound lasts a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: What everyone else tries to copy
customer_reviews.text: Remo is what everyone else tries to copy. Some do a fairly good job, but the copies' sound fades quickly, whereas Remo's sound lasts a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Happy Homecoming
customer_reviews.text: Used coated ambassadors way back in the day, my first set was a 1960s Leedy set. Have played single ply, double ply, pinstriple, hydaulic, black dot, white dot, and silver dot. Honestly, this is the feel and sound I have been looking for all along. No wonder so many recording professionals use these heads. If you want to play and enjoy your instrument, if you enjoy using the full range of your instrument, then I suggest that you try these great heads.
customer_reviews.author: JBdrumstick

customer_reviews.title: They came very fast and fit like a charm
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend ordered these for his set when his other busted. They came very fast and fit like a charm. Sounds great too. Very glad to hear the music again while folding laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Abby L. Coldiron

customer_reviews.title: Best durability and performance over other heads.
customer_reviews.text: Love this head. Always makes any snare "talk" from ghost notes to a buzz before the main stroke note. Stays in tune and temps don't bother it. Lasts 6 months at least at 2-3 gigs a month with a practice 2 hour session each week.
customer_reviews.author: Thundersticks

customer_reviews.title: Good coated head
customer_reviews.text: I am using this head and it is very decent, my only gripe is that I just can't seem to fasten it super-tight enough to get the snap sound that I really want. I'm hoping as I beat on it over time, it might stretch a bit and allow a greater fasten-down.
customer_reviews.author: DannMann

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and produce good sound
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic drum heads for the price. They get used and abused quite a bit at our church (drum lessons, worship sets, and practices) and they seem to be holding up well and producing great sound.
customer_reviews.author: TKTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Timely shipping.  Dependable product.
customer_reviews.text: REMO heads are the industry standard for a reason. They excel at sounding good while retaining tunability. They never feel "hard" or "brittle" like Evans heads.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Ewers

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I expected from this head. It sounded hollow, empty of any tone. Im sticking to my remo powerstroke.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic drum head used for a Tom
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic drum head used for a Tom. You can't do any wrong when putting a Remo Ambassador drum head on any drum.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful head to use as a resonant. I cut a hole in both of the ones I got and they help make the kick drums sound wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Brenden D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drum head!
customer_reviews.text: Love this replacement snare head I purchased for my church kit. Sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great as always from Remo
customer_reviews.text: Remo is all I ever use and this one is good (just as expected).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Typical Remo quality
customer_reviews.text: These are typical Remo quality heads well suited to snare drum batter heads. On toms I typically prefer a two ply head for the batter side but on snares a single ply coated head works well. I bought a couple to have new ones around as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bloose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great resident head. My son used it as a bottom head and it created a "warm" sound.
customer_reviews.author: Lori B.

customer_reviews.title: Just like Brian Wilson did
customer_reviews.text: This came in perfect condition. I purchased this to get autographs. It now hangs proudly on my wall with a rock legends autograph.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Still the industry leader.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sounding, most versatile and long lasting snare head for any playing style. I always keep one on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Cornish

customer_reviews.title: Remo mainstay
customer_reviews.text: Good snare head but not to be used for brush work - I occasionally get a dud that I can't get a good bounce on but Remo is probably the best of the major drum skin makers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Powder coating
customer_reviews.text: Good drum skin, but a hair was embedded in the powder coating. Expected a higher quality form a Remo Ambassador
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Love playing, puts out an equal sound
customer_reviews.text: Love playing, puts out an equal sound, mine was giving me too much bass so I switched to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Propes

customer_reviews.title: Always a good choice
customer_reviews.text: As a Remo fan, this is just what I needed in time for the next gig.
customer_reviews.author: Average Customer

customer_reviews.title: The standard
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of different drum heads but keep coming back to the standard. The thing I like about the Amassador is that it is so basic. Go with basic and work from there.
customer_reviews.author: Coxm 255

customer_reviews.title: Great drumhead
customer_reviews.text: It's a very versatile and clean-sounding drumhead. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This fits perfectly. It was a day late but the package was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Cabinetman34

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect snare head for any set. Best you're gonna find around this price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this head because the snare head I got with a head pack was absolute junk. This head is durable and improves sound greatly. it gives you that nice snap sound without having to be overtightened
customer_reviews.author: camden108

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but with the REMO name you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: The Paradise Big Band

customer_reviews.title: These are great heads.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a few others to replace some old clear bottoms on a used kit. Now they look and sound brand new. Remos will dent, but I have yet to punch through one, despite trying.
customer_reviews.author: sdmaturin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful sounding head
customer_reviews.text: On my lowest tuned floor tom. It offers a sound differential I'm looking for and gives me a lot of tone power whether I lay into the drum or not.
customer_reviews.author: fillnns

customer_reviews.title: A nice clean sound
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great on my 16x16 pearl export tom and my breakbeats toms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Great, versatile snare head. Will work in most musical styles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have drummed for 40+ years. These heads have always been consistant, and long lasting. My kit has 11 ply shells and needs little or no damping of overtones. After tuning, it was ready!
customer_reviews.author: JAR

customer_reviews.title: Great Drum Head
customer_reviews.text: Always a great head. Using it on a floor tom. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome head! Very happy with it but it didnt ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome head! Very happy with it but it didnt last that long only because Im a heavy hitter. Great crack, and great overtone sound
customer_reviews.author: Albert Medina

customer_reviews.title: Wrong head sent :( no ambassador clear 14 in my order
customer_reviews.text: I ordered new heads for my contrail setup, and I received an ambassador hazy instead of the regular ambassador in the description. There was already that exact head in my order, but I’m going to keep it and put it on another snare.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Straughan

customer_reviews.title: Give me head. Drum head.
customer_reviews.text: Great drum head, I use it on my snare, works great. Sound is good, durable and long lasting as well. Nice job remo
customer_reviews.author: Neutrality

customer_reviews.title: REMO 15" CLEAR DRUM HEAD
customer_reviews.text: REMO PRODUCTS ARE THE STANDARD OF EXCELLENCE, I HAVE NEVER HAD A PROBLEM WITH THESE TYPES OF HEADS EVER. I WILL KEEP USING THEM UNTIL SOMETHING BETTER COMES ALONG. I'AM USING THESE HEADS FOR A TIMBALE APPLICATION AND I LOVE THE WAY THAT THEY RESONATE. IN A LIVE SETTING YOU CAN'T BEAT THE PUNCH AND CRACKS THESE HEADS GIVE OUT.
